@@ -0,0 +1,84 @@
+<!--
+  ~ Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+  ~ Licensed under the MIT License.
+  -->
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+    <artifactId>azure-client-sdk-parent</artifactId>
+    <version>1.7.0</version> <!-- {x-version-update;com.azure:azure-client-sdk-parent;current} -->
+    <relativePath>../../parents/azure-client-sdk-parent</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+  <artifactId>azure-core-experimental</artifactId>
+  <packaging>jar</packaging>
+  <version>1.0.0-beta.1</version> <!-- {x-version-update;com.azure:azure-core-experimental;current} -->
+
+  <name>Microsoft Azure Java Core Experimental Library</name>
+  <description>This package contains experimental core types for Azure Java clients.</description>
+  <url>https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java</url>
+
+  <licenses>
+    <license>
+      <name>The MIT License (MIT)</name>
+      <url>http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT</url>
+      <distribution>repo</distribution>
+    </license>
+  </licenses>
+
+  <distributionManagement>
+    <site>
+      <id>azure-java-build-docs</id>
+      <url>${site.url}/site/${project.artifactId}</url>
+    </site>
+  </distributionManagement>
+
+  <scm>
+    <url>https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java</url>
+    <connection>scm:git:https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java.git</connection>
+    <developerConnection>scm:git:https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java.git</developerConnection>
+  </scm>
+
+  <properties>
+    <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
+    <legal><![CDATA[[INFO] Any downloads listed may be third party software.  Microsoft grants you no rights for third party software.]]></legal>
+  </properties>
+
+  <developers>
+    <developer>
+      <id>microsoft</id>
+      <name>Microsoft</name>
+    </developer>
+  </developers>
+
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+      <artifactId>azure-core</artifactId>
+      <version>1.6.0-beta.1</version> <!-- {x-version-update;com.azure:azure-core;current} -->
+    </dependency>
+  </dependencies>
+

timeline.bodyText:
Module names should be the same as the root package name com.azure.core.experimental.
https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_design.html#modules
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+module azure.core.experimental {

timeline.bodyText: I guess we can start with the serialize and deserialize methods that is used in the latest avro PR. Might help unblock @arerlend  too.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@

+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.core.experimental.serializer;
+
+/**
+ * Generic interface for object serialization.
+ */
+public interface ObjectSerializer {
+}

replies.bodyText: That is one of my goals with this change, to unblock testing of the serialization interfaces. This will require package import changes once these changes make their way into Azure Core proper.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Add module to test coverage, fixed module name, removed dead configuration in POM

timeline.bodyText: This package should forever remain a beta as we don't want folks taking shipping dependencies on it. Do we have any great way to help enforce that?
timeline.author: weshaggard

replies.bodyText: Not that I know of currently, @JimSuplizio do you have anything?
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
@alzimmermsft @weshaggard
There's nothing preventing anyone from changing the version of any library and shipping it so long as the version passes the format check and they have approval permissions. There's never been a "this library must remain beta" requirement before.
replies.author: JimSuplizio

replies.bodyText: OK @alzimmermsft @srnagar please try to keep an eye our to try and prevent this from shipping a GA as it will defeat the entire purpose of it if we do.
replies.author: weshaggard
